intro: Galium leyboldii, commonly known as the Leybold's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium leyboldii is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the bedstraw genus.
